intro: Gonipia pumila, commonly known as the dwarf rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round seeds. Gonipia pumila is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
